Class Encryptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Alphabet
      • Encryptor

  • public class Encryptor
extends Alphabet
    The Encryptor class is the class entirely responsible for encrypting the text within a text document. It handles this by first converting the text documents contents to a String, then by extending the Alphabet class, converts every letter within that string to it's corresponding integer value (0-26, representing A and Z respectively). These values (referred to as the letter's "index") are then added to values from the encryption-codexKey. After they're reconverted to the new index's corresponding letter.
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

      User selected value that dictates the encryption codexKey start position (starting from 0)
      private KeyGenerator codexObject
      Reference to the codexObject object from the KeyGenerator class containing the encryption codexKey
      private java.lang.String filePath
      User specified filepath for the file to encrypt
      private java.lang.String originalPhrase
      String containing the unencrypted text from the file to be encrypted
      private Alphabet originalPhraseObject
      Reference to the originalPhraseObject in the Alphabet class
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> shiftedIndex
      ArrayList of Integers containing the originalPhrase's letter index after being added to the encryption-codexKey's values

    • Method Detail

      • getOriginalPhraseFromDoc

        public java.lang.String getOriginalPhraseFromDoc()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in the phrase to encrypt from a text file at a user specified location (filePath)
        Returns:
        Returns the String version of the text read in from the file-to-be-encrypted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throw IOException when the method cannot find the user specified filepath

      • shiftIndex

        public void shiftIndex()
        Converts the originalPhrase to it's corresponding letter index. After this the method reads in integer values from the "codex" (encryption-codexKey) starting at the "codexKey"'s value. Each letter index is added to the encryption-codexKey's value and then shifted within the range 0-26 using Alphabet's indexValidity checker. The resulting letter index is saved to the instance variable shiftedIndex.

      • printEncryptedPhrase

        public java.lang.String printEncryptedPhrase()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Converts the integers in the shiftedIndex ArrayList to a string. Then the method prints this string to overwrites the original file with both the codexKey and encrypted text.
        Returns:
        returns String containing the now encrypted phrase
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException if it cannot find the user specified file
